bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, March 14, 1941

div1.p: Hench is pleased that Rodriguez Leon will assist the Wyeth Company with details for the planned conquerors of yellow fever painting.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, March 14, 1941
div1.opener:
March 14, 1941
Senora Estela Agramonte Rodriguez-Leon
Calle 15 No. 311
Vedado, Habana
Cuba
My dear Senora Rodriguez-Leon:
div1.p:
I appreciated your letter very greatly and know that the Wyeth Co.
people will appreciate it also. Their desire is to have as good a painting as
possible, and they are paying several thousand dollars to have it done. I
know they will be glad to have your cooperation, and I expect you will be
hearing from them in due time.

I am not surprised that you did not see them. There is a long story
connected with that, and I will tell it to you when I see you.

I am ordering a copy of Dr. Finlay's book, and will bring it with
me to present to you with my sincere compliments. I am afraid I will be
arriving at a time not too convenient for you. I am so anxious to get a glimpse
of what material you might have of your father's that if it were convenient
for you I would be delighted to pay for the services of some husky laborer who
might go out to your country home and move around the boxes that you mentioned,
under your supervision. Perhaps I am being presumptuous in making this suggestion
and if I am, I know you will forgive me. At any rate, it will be a real pleasure
to see you and your good husband again, and I think I will have some information
regarding my yellow fever investigations which will interest you.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
